reviews.text: Amabilidad y buen servicio.
Absolutely fantastic hole in the wall spot. Water always full, bread basket refilled twice, complementary cheese plate, and shot! Food was authentic Italian. 10/10
I sat down for dinner around 8:30 p.m. Our waiter was terribly impatient and irritated.

First, they put us in the corner and ignored us.
Second, they were missing an ingredient in salad
Third / very slow slow and I was too tired to eat
4th - the spaghetti is good but no worth the effort
Been going to Isle of Capri for over 40 years and it is excellent every time.
Armando was our server. He felt like family. This place was super accommodating. The staff was so kind and the food was delicious!!!
The Melanzane alla Parmigiana was delicious. Isle of Capri was extremely affordable for a Manhattan restaurant.

I highly recommend Isle of Capri when I hear anyone say I'm going to NYC. The food is stellar. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. The service is impeccable. The last time I was here was 2019 and ohhh do I constantly dream about the food. I'll be in the city this December and Isle of Capri will definitely be my first stop for dinner. Thank you for the great food and memories!
The food was kinda below average for restaurant food, and very overpriced.
Î©ÏÎ±Î¯Î¿ Ï†Î±Î³Î·Ï„ÏŒ
The bake lasagna was almost all cheese. I had been there before and it was good but last night it just wasnt.
A lingering...extended afternoon of deliciousness in a non rushed atmosphere.
One of the oldest restaurants in NYC. The basement especially feels like youâ€™re transported to a different country.

I would have been better off opening up a can of chef boyardee. The food was awful. The service was great though. Go to olive garden. While I don't consider olive garden, actual italian food, their food is better than this place.
Beautiful, cozy, quiet atmosphere. Wonderful staff.  Very good authentic meals. I had tripe stew and my wife had salmon. Greatly enjoyed this place.

Always a pleasurable experience at Isle of Capri. Delicious food, professional and friendly waiters,comfortable atmosphere. The owners come around to your table to say hello, very nice. Treat yourself to a good time at Isle of Capri!
Great spot for lunch. Good food, great quick service and solid price. Had the tortellini and it was fantastic
We come back to this restaurant every time we visit NYC. Excellent food and the kindest staff
Large portions. The seafood spaghetti was solid

From far, our favorite restaurant in NYC. Feels so at home. Food is delicious, great wine selection and amazing service. Team goes above and beyond, it is our to go place when we want a night out with my husband
Typical NYC Italian restaurant. Unfortunately super expensive the last years
Caprese salad had to go back (hairs in it). Lasagne was the worst I've ever tasted. Obviously, an establishment trading on locals and past glories. We won't be back.
Old school restaurant with astonishing service! It deserves
Authentic Italian restaurant. Just like my nanny used to make.  Canâ€™t wait to come back and bring family.

Way too noisy. Food wonderful! Service was excellent even though there were people waiting for a table. Make sure to get a reservation. Go early which cuts down on the noise.  Have wide screen everywhere.

Beautiful place! We went to celebrate a friendâ€™s birthday, and everything was amazing! The staff was very friendly, the service was fast, and the food was deliciousâ€”great quality and generous portions. The martinis were so good that we ordered three!
In town for weekend and stumbled upon this place. So happy we did.... amazing food and atmosphere, and all the staff were so friendly. Thanks to Drana and team for the great dinner. We will be back!

I think the service was swell and it was kind of them to accommodate a walk-in. Despite such a brief stay, the servers were very accommodating and professional - for which I appreciated. Customer service is the utmost quality in a dining experience despite the food, but coupled with that - itâ€™s more the better. I will be back soon to try more dishes.
Fantastic restaurant! I highly recommend coming here, and I will be back. Juan was amazing!

What a delightful experience! Delicious food in a cozy environment. The owner came to speak with me and I learned that her grandparents opened the restaurant in 1955 and itâ€™s been family owned ever since. Itâ€™s obvious a lot of love went into and still goes into this place and Iâ€™m grateful for the experience of dining here.
Old school excellent service!!!!

Food perfect and delicious
Place and Table are too tight not comfortable
Always an amazing time! My favorite rigatoni vodka pasta! Best service and great ambiance.
food is awfulğŸ«
The owner, Maria, greets you at the door instead of some high school kid. Its incredibly authentic italian food. The waiter Andres is wonderful.
Andres and Maria were extremely kind and gave us an amazing night. Would love to come again. Food was incredible!

We stumbled upon this place about 15 years ago. Every time we go, it's just as amazing as the first. Food is incredible, servers are attentive, vibes are immaculate. It is authentic Italian food and environment. If not for how well behaved the cars are outside, you would think you're in Italy!

Absolutely amazing food and service! My boyfriend and I love to split meals, so we ordered the Pollo Alla Parmigiana, and the Paglia E Fieno. Our waiter knew we were splitting and brought the dishes out from the kitchen already split half and half!! The food tasted absolutely amazing. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for great Italian food in the neighborhood.
Great food.   Friendly staff, and good service...  same today

We had an amazing experience at this family-owned Italian gem in NYC! The food was delicious, authentic, and beautifully prepared. Our server, Andres, went above and beyond, providing exceptional service with a friendly and attentive attitude. Highly recommend this spot for a fantastic meal and top-notch service! Will definitely be back!
Always a delightful experience

Best food and service I have had at any restaurant, not just in New York! We were greeted immediately, and sat without delay. Juan was our server and he took great care of us, making sure our drinks were always topped off and that we had everything we needed. We shared a lot of good conversation and laughs with him. He mentioned he has been working there for over 20 years! Ask for him at table number 24 if you choose to dine here.

I had the salmon, and my friends each had a tomato based pasta dish. Everything was a 10/10 across the board!
I have to commend this place for its beautiful design! It felt like I wasnâ€™t in NYC. The staff were very kind, and itâ€™s a perfect little getaway from the busy Midtown.
Beautiful place with delicious authentic italian food. Super friendly and professional stuff. Charming vibe. Nice and quiet:)

Love this place. Had dinner. Got the sauteed liver with onions. Sooo good.
Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Always a pleasure to be here
We love the Isle of Capri. Excellent food, atmosphere, and service. Ask for Andres. ğŸ˜Š

Excellent local, family-owned Italian restaurant. Love this place! Iâ€™ve never had a bad experience here and they treat you like family! And of course must finish dinner with their top notch tiramisu.

My husband and I were in the hands of Andras, the Master, and wonderful Arturo!  We have strayed and never will!!!  We are treated so beautifully, we can't t wait to return to feast and enjoy this special staff!!!
Fantastic service and everything was delicious! Will be going back again!

Located in the Upper East Side this restaurant offers a wide variety of Italian classics like Eggplant Parmigiana, Veal Marsala, Veal Parmigiana and for dessert Chocolate Profiteroles. The service is outstanding, specially if you are served by Mr. Armando who is extremely friendly and courteous. Highly recommended!

Highly recommended. The staff was very friendly, accommodating, attentive. A welcoming and decorative restaurant, there is plenty of seating inside the main dining room, or we chose to sit along the edge of the restruant inside with lots of windows and people watching. There is an extensive menu here, we enjoyed the chicken Parmesan, sauteed shrimp, and the veal Parmesan, great portions... esp since we were so hungry!! Served fresh and hot, along with the complimentary bread and bruscetta. A great neighborhood find with a charming atmosphere. Enjoy!
Charming corner restaurant!  Traditional Italian food and excellent service!  Recommend their Branzino special and calamari! Mostly locals dining here.

Isle of Capri is a fantastic Italian restaurant in the UES serving some of the most fresh and authentic Italian cuisine I have ever had. The restaurant gives off an intimate vibe with old-style decor and comfortable seating. It felt like a restaurant out of an old movie scene. The staff is very attentive and friendly. They were able to give us good suggestions off the menu and served us with a smile.

They started us off with some warm bread and butter but we didn't even eat that much since our order came out so quick. My party ordered the eggplant and chicken parm, and let me tell you that eggplant parm was out of this world. The thin and crispy eggplant layered with cheese and sauce just melted in my mouth. I would go back just to order more of that. Since I am vegetarian, I didn't get to try the chicken parm but my friend devoured the entire dish, so I'm assuming it was very good.

The restaurant is very clean and spacious. They have private seating as well as main floor seating. Parking is difficult to find near the restaurant so try to walk or come by subway.

5 stars!

This is by far one of the greatest experiences ive had at a restaurant. Last time i gave a review at a restaurant was because they deserved something great said & This place is recommended to everyone looking for a place to dine & feel like the food is from home & youre treated like family.

I have no complaints other than being treated too good where im like woahhâ€¦ why? Lol

Trust me you wont regret dining here.

The dish that we had was linguine gamberetti trust me you wont regret it ğŸ‘ŒğŸ¼

Ask for Armando, he treated us like family ğŸ‘ŒğŸ¼

What an amazing restaurant! After getting a procedure done at the nearby institute I looked here for a last minute reservation.

The interior is gorgeous, and holds many authentic Italian decorations. The hostess was very friendly, and the waiters were quick to refill water, recommend specific items and drinks, and stay nearby for anything we might need. Talk about above and beyond!

We got the Spaghetti and Meatballs and their daily special, which was a Linguini with Shrimp and bites of Lobster. Absolutely heavenly! Nice for a romantic or intimate outing, or for a family affair. Fresh bread was also provided, and it was definitely fresh, with complimentary bruschetta offered to boot!

What a lovely experience, definitely consider this for your next Italian outing. Juan was great, the hostess was great and the manager was so friendly and personal!

The service is very nice and the meatball is just so tender and full of flavors. I was also pleasantly surprised to discover that beef honeycomb tripes are featured in Italian cuisines as well, and they taste great tho a little boring with a full plate.

First time here due to a recommendation of a friend and I was glad I came! The food was amazing and definitely one of the best authentic Italian cuisines Iâ€™ve had. The prices were great and portions were huge. Be prepared to come on an empty stomach!

I started off with their lentil soup (pictured) which I enjoyed. I have often eaten at Italian restaurants, but I rarely see a sausage with mushrooms and peppers entree (pictured) being offered on a New York City restaurant menu. I believe it was listed as one of Isle of Capri's specialties. The large portion is served here with a nice tomato sauce and a side dish of green beans and potatoes. The sausage and peppers were delicious, the cost was $28. I have posted pictures of the inside (taken at 3 p.m.), and outside of the restaurant. They do not close between lunch and dinner time periods.

Very antique style restaurant. Italian style, decent amount of food serve. The food is good, but the pasta is a little too sweet for me other than that their waiters treat you with respect and they are welcoming to your needs or wants.â€¦

Unbelievable! We got off the plane and came right here a recommendation from a friend that comes here weekly.

You have to get Freddy as the Server. Been for years, perfect food. Homemade fresh pasta. The chicken Parm was cooked to perfection.
The deserts are to die for, itâ€™s like taking a step back into old Italy ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡¹

They finish you off with a proper lemon chello.

I would highly recommend for anyone in the area.

The service was amazing and the staff were very friendly. I think the interior didnâ€™t  match the name of the restaurant. When I think of Capri, I think of bright colors and lemons but the interior was dark and more about Romans than beingâ€¦
Pleasant atmosphere, delicious food, great class oreganato.  The Cosmo cocktail was made to perfection.

Disappointing and disrespectful. Due to the arrogant and slow service with no smiles or respectful attitude at all (I don't know why?), I decided not to leave a suggested tip. Despite this, I still left a 15% tip, which wasn't worth it. The outrageous one is that my bank statement later showed an extra $20 charge over what I had left. Does that mean I have to pay 30%+? Why?

For the experience, after a while of placing my order, they told me the many dishes on Specialities I ordered were unavailable (even simple lasagna). None of the staff seemed to understand the menu. I still accepted the replacements politely. It seems that this friendliness was not understood at all. The bread was terrible, but the pasta was okay.

Changing the tip goes against the spirit of American restaurants.

A nice, authentic atmosphere and good food!

I had the pepperoncini, which was good! I donâ€™t know a lot about authentic Italian cuisine but the only reason I didnâ€™t give 5 stars was bc I didnâ€™t think the noodles were nearly as good as Iâ€™ve had at other Italian places. Iâ€™ve also never had this dish before but I really did enjoy it!

A person I came with said it was the best chicken parm heâ€™s had in his life (later amended to top 5 but still passionately). Bread on the table before the meal and all Italian uncles in at lunch time made me feel open to trying it again!

Went here for dinner with some friends.  Overall impressions: quality food and service.  Some dishes felt lackluster but the experience was pleasant.

Ordered the shrimp cocktail, linguine alla Carbonara and Frutti di Mare.  Would say the Frutti di Mare was not great because the seafood felt a little "fishy" and rubbery.

Other classic dishes and appetizers were of high quality but I cannot recommend the Frutti di Mare.

Itâ€™s a lovely place with very nice service.
My mother had the Manicotti al Forno which she enjoyed very much, said the tomato sauce was not too acid and would have eaten more. I had the Vittelo Franceseâ€¦

First time that we ate here and were pleasantly surprised,
The dishes are generous and delicious, the service is pleasant, the place is tastefully decorated and the prices are fair,
Warmly recommended.

I had no idea that this was on the fancier side of restaurants when we went in. I wouldnâ€™t recommend wearing jeans and a t-shirt as it is white table cloth but the staff didnâ€™t mind and they were very fast and attentive. The food was delicious, their vodka sauce is some of the best.

So much fun!! Food was amazing!! Super affordable!! Amazing Italian food. Extras all around- bruschetta to begin with, yummy bread, great wine amazing food, outstanding dessert and deliciousness to end with. Wow!!
pretty nice dinner and service! they were nice enough to already split the plate we were sharing
